content: In a village, there are 10 families. Each family has at least one child. If the total number of children in the village is 20, what is the maximum number of families that can have only one child?

First, since each family has at least one child, that means the minimum number of children per family is one. If all 10 families had exactly one child, there would be 10 children in total. Our goal is to maximize the number of families with only one child. To do that, we need to minimize the number of families that have more than one child. Because the more children some families have, the fewer families need to have extra children to reach the total of 20.
